poem:
**Waters of Division**  

In the stillness of the pond,  
do they discern the ripples  
of a soul searching form?  
Nature, in her vast pool,  
genders only reflected light.  
Yet, men with measuring rods  
and stone hearts consult to  
divide sunlit waters,  
seeking to part  
what only light has united.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hampstead Heath swimming ponds considering limiting transgender users’ access A consultation has been launched on transgender swimmers’ access to Hampstead Heath ponds, which could result in them being banned from using the pools for the gender they identify as. The Kenwood Ladies’ and Highgate Men’s ponds are gender-segregated, with trans people currently able to swim in whichever they feel most appropriate, or use the Heath’s mixed-gender pond instead. The consultation by the City of London". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
